title: Principled and Efficient Motif Finding for Structure Learning of Lifted Graphical Models. (arXiv:2302.04599v2 [cs.AI] UPDATED)
abstract: Structure learning is a core problem in AI central to the fields of neuro-symbolic AI and statistical relational learning. It consists in automatically learning a logical theory from data. The basis for structure learning is mining repeating patterns in the data, known as structural motifs. Finding these patterns reduces the exponential search space and therefore guides the learning of formulas. Despite the importance of motif learning, it is still not well understood. We present the first principled approach for mining structural motifs in lifted graphical models, languages that blend first-order logic with probabilistic models, which uses a stochastic process to measure the similarity of entities in the data. Our first contribution is an algorithm, which depends on two intuitive hyperparameters: one controlling the uncertainty in the entity similarity measure, and one controlling the softness of the resulting rules. Our second contribution is a preprocessing step where we perform hie

ret.translated_title: 针对提升图模型结构学习的原则和高效模体发现
ret.translated_abstract: 结构学习是人工智能中的核心问题，是神经符号AI和统计关系学习领域的基础，其目标是从数据中自动学习逻辑理论。结构学习的基础是挖掘数据中的重复模式，即结构模体。找到这些模式可以减少指数级的搜索空间，因此引导公式的学习。尽管模体学习非常重要，但其仍未得到很好的理解。我们提出了一种基于随机过程的方法，用于测量数据中实体的相似性，从而在提升图模型中挖掘结构模体。我们的第一项贡献是一种算法，它依赖于两个直观的超参数：一个控制实体相似性测量的不确定性，另一个控制结果规则的柔软度。我们的第二项贡献是预处理步骤，我们在其中执行了分层
ret.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于随机过程的方法，在提升图模型中挖掘结构模体，以便从数据中自动学习逻辑理论。
